channel.title: Could not find process:Java
channel.description:
ok so i installed java 18 and did all that environmental variables but i get this error.
Could not find process:java when i run my run.bat
my run.bat says this:
@echo off cls echo Voule Auto restart tskill java /a echo Restarting server title EvolutionX. java -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server cls
where do i put C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_18\bin

item.title: Could not find process:Java
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote=“colossusx7, post:5, topic:345680”]how do i set it i got java jdk 6u21

@echo off
cls
echo Voule Auto restart
tskill java /a
echo Restarting server
title EvolutionX.
“C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe” -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server
cls[/quote]
Don’t hi-jack threads.

@OP; It’s trying to kill the Java task. Like when you go into Task Manager and end a process.

Just remove the tskill java /a line…

@echo off
title EvolutionX.
"C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server

Read full topic

item.title: Could not find process:Java
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Theres no problem… Its trying to kill the process but its not running to begin with.

Read full topic

item.title: Could not find process:Java

@new2servers wrote:

so are you saying i didn’t set environmental variables right? sorry but im having a hard time understanding you

item.title: Could not find process:Java
item.dc:creator: @JaydenD12 JaydenD12
item.description:
@JaydenD12 wrote:

[quote=“noobs are ftw, post:2, topic:345680”]try this

@echo off
cls
echo Voule Auto restart
tskill java /a
echo Restarting server
title EvolutionX.
“C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe” -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server
cls[/quote]

It’s trying to kill the java process when you initialize the batch file, and if there is no java process obviously it’s going to say it can’t find the process… Hence the “tskill java /a”.

Read full topic
